alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 9:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN AND NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 958 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lake Santee, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Osgood, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Metamora, Napoleon, Andersonville, Huntersville, Hamburg, Ballstown, Penntown, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, Peppertown and Buena Vista. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 157. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
